meanings.definition: To take into one's possession or control by force or skill
meanings.sent1: The brave knight captured the dragon in his net.
meanings.sent2: The police captured the thief after a long chase.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox captured the farmer's attention with its antics.
meanings.sent4: Her beautiful painting captured the essence of the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The photographer captured the joy of the children playing in the park.

meanings.definition: To record or represent accurately in a medium
meanings.sent1: She captured the moment on film before it was gone.
meanings.sent2: The artist captured the scene on canvas with great detail.
meanings.sent3: The writer captured the essence of the character in her novel.
meanings.sent4: The historian captured the events of the past in his book.
meanings.sent5: The scientist captured the data in his research paper for publication.

meanings.definition: To attract and hold the attention or interest of
meanings.sent1: The magician captured the audience's attention with his tricks.
meanings.sent2: The singer captured the hearts of the crowd with her beautiful voice.
meanings.sent3: The comedian captured everyone's interest with his hilarious jokes.
meanings.sent4: The movie captured the imagination of viewers with its stunning visuals.
meanings.sent5: The book captured the reader's attention from the very first page.
